General Information.Research Interest: I am interested in ''Control Dynamics'' and ''Nonlinear Control'', focusing on creating adaptive, intelligent control systems. I also explore ''Machine Learning'' to enhance these systems. My aim is to leverage this technology to achieve seamless interaction between humans and robots.

research.name: Advanced Intelligent Mechatronics Research Laboratory (AIMRL) - Georgia Tech
research.position: Development of a Magnetic Series Elastic Actuator (Mag-SEA)
highlights: Iteratively optimized the Mag-SEA for enhanced functionality and developed a Mechanical Series Elastic Actuator for benchmark testing.
Identifying the system and developing an impedance control system, enhancing precision in dynamic interaction environments.

Related Paper: Magnetic Stiffness of Soft Continuous Permanent Magnet and its Parametric Effects on a Magnetic Series Elastic Actuator Control System, W. Li, K.-M. Lee∗, M.-G. Park, R. Huang and M. Li, “Magnetic Stiffness of Soft Continuous Permanent Magnet and its Parametric Effects on a Magnetic Series Elastic Actuator Control System”, IEEE/ASME International Conference on Advanced Intelligent Mechatronics (AIM), 7, 2024

research.name: Adaptive Robotic Manipulation (ARM) Laboratory - Georgia Tech
research.position: Development of an Underactuated Gripper Using Controllable Stiffness Joints
highlights: Implemented a PID controller system to track and regulate air pressure in chambers, adjusting joint stiffness.
Analyzed gripper-object interactions, focusing on how joint stiffness affects the dexterity and precision of robotic manipulations.

research.name: Robotics Lab - POSTECH
research.position: Multisensory Anomaly Detection for Mobile Robot in Smart Factories using Spatiotemporal Context Extraction
highlights: Developed an anomaly detection system leveraging RANSAC-Flow and f-AnoGAN algorithms to analyze spatiotemporal context in thermal videos from a mobile surveillance robot, implemented using PyTorch.

projects.name: Simulation and Control of Multi-Link Mechanisms
projects.summary: Implementing and simulating both linear and nonlinear control strategies for an inverted pendulum in Simulink, focusing on stability, tracking, and regulation.
highlights: Methods: PID with Gravity Compensation Method & Computed Torque Method, Linear Quadratic Regulator, Bang-Bang Controller, Fuzzy Logic Controller, Gain Scheduling Controller, Self-Tuning Controller, Model-Reference Adaptive Control, Model Predictive Control, Sliding Mode Control, Backstepping Controller, Neural Network Controller

projects.name: Robot Arm Optimization
projects.summary: Performed Finite Element Analysis (FEA) to optimize a robotic arm's design focusing on stress distribution and fatigue resistance.

projects.name: Dynamics of a Triple Pendulum
projects.summary: Conducted a simulation of a triple pendulum's dynamics using the Euler-Lagrange equations to derive its motion equations, and implemented the simulation in Python.

projects.name: Adaptive Cornhole Device for Individuals with Spinal Cord Injuries
projects.summary: Developed an ergonomic, adaptive tool for individuals with spinal cord injuries. Utilized iterative prototyping, user feedback, ergonomic evaluations, and FEA for optimization and structural integrity.

work.name: Georgia Institute of Technology
highlights: Conducted 2-hour weekly office hours and delivered review lectures, assisting over 60 students in control systems engineering.
Achieved a 4.9/5.0 average in TA evaluations, with 100% of students endorsing me for future courses.
Topic: Modeling in the Laplace domain, Time response analysis, Stability analysis, Root-locus analysis and design, Frequency domain analysis and design, State-space design

work.name: Samsung Electronics
highlights: Project: Mobile Robot Arm Auto Calibration
Developed an algorithm using Robot Operating System (ROS) to evaluate the precision and reliability of a KUKA robot arm by assessing its repeatability according to ISO 9283 standards.

work.name: Samsung Electronics
highlights: Developed a TensorFlow-based anomaly detection model for image data, achieving 92% top-1 accuracy.
Led a deep learning seminar for team members, covering AI fundamentals, training methodologies, and troubleshooting strategies to enhance their research capabilities.

volunteer.summary: Facilitated hands-on activities for preschoolers, including paper chromatography and invisible ink experiments.
Facilitated workshops where students built and tested model cars, applying the concepts of aerodynamics, energy conservation, and potential energy in a practical setting.
Demonstrated building cardboard hands and exhibit a real robotic hand
Instructed students in a rural area with limited education resources.

volunteer.organization: SKKU Global Mentoring and Assisting People
volunteer.summary: Facilitated cultural adaptation and integration for international students in Korea by leading cultural exchange programs.

memberships.organization: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE)
Georgia Tech chapter of the American Society of Mechanical Engineers
